News.headline: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 2 Worthing
News.page_title: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 2 Worthing
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: Dagenham and Redbridge 1 - 2 Worthing
News.short_description: Dagenham and Redbridge were knocked out in the first round proper of the FA Trophy by Worthing.
News.description:
Paul Benson’s first half goal gave the Daggers the lead, but that was cancelled out by two second half goals, the first a Josh Staunton own goal and the winner was by Lloyd Dawes.

Two changes were made to the Daggers after last week’s away victory at Dover, Luke Guttridge and Elliot Justham, were both swapped for Frankie Raymond and Mark Cousins.

It was the visitors who had the better of chances in the first ten minutes of the game, but they weren’t enough to test Cousins. 

17 minutes into the game and Worthing looked to have been one up, after Omar Bugiel’s shot managed to beat Cousins, but it ended up coming off the post.

A minute later, Paul Benson played whitely through the middle of the Worthing defence, however the forward was unable to keep his shot on target.  

The Daggers took the lead five minutes before half time, it was Paul Benson who tapped it into an open goal. 

Corey Whitely had a chance a minute into the second half, as he cut in from the right and curled it towards goal, the shot ended up being easily caught by Jack Fagan. 

Jordan Maguire-Drew showed great individual play in the 53rd minute, as he beat his marker and cut in, but the final shot was poor. 

Minutes later and Maguire-Drew was still creating chances as he played a low ball across goal, Benson was then close to getting on the end of it.

The visitors got the equaliser in the 63rd minute, Josh Staunton put it into the back of his own net after Will Hendon crossed the ball into the box.

Lloyd Dawes came very close to scoring a spectacular, as he controlled it in mid-air and volleyed from the edge of box, however the ball ended up inches over the crossbar.

Seconds later the goal came for the visitors an Error from Magnus Okuonghae enabled Dawes to run onto goal and put it past Cousins in the 71st minute. 

Dawes came very close to getting a third for Worthing, but Cousins did well to deny him at the near post.

The Daggers will now need to focus on next week’s league match against Solihull Moors.

Daggers: Cousins, Widdowson, Doe, Raymond, Assombalonga (45 Hawkins), Benson (78 White), Maguire-Drew (88 Heard), Boucaud, Whitely, Okuonaghae, Staunton
Unused subs: Justham, Gordon

Worthing: Fagan, Hendon, Rents, Wills, Cook, Heath, Dawes, O'Neill (69 Edwards), Bugiel, Newton, Sparks (88 Brodie)
Unused subs: Belward, Boiling, Watson
